duck: Infusion (roller coaster), a roller coaster at Pleasure Beach, Blackpool, UK
infusion definition: the act or process of infusing.
Intravenous infusion, the infusion of liquid substances directly into a vein
Infusion - An infusion is the outcome of steeping plants that have desired chemical compounds or flavors in a solvent such as water or oil or alcohol.
Tea infuser, a device in which loose tea leaves are placed for brewing

{{multiple image
| footer = Yerba mate (left), coffee and tea (right) are used to create
| caffeinated infusions. image1 = Mate mit Stengeln.jpg width1 = 150 alt1 =
| caption1 = image2 = Coffee Beans Photographed in Macro.jpg width2 = 100 alt2 =
| caption2 = image3 = Loose leaf darjeeling tea twinings.jpg width3 = 100 alt3 =
| caption3 =
}} 'Infusion' is the process of extracting chemical compounds or flavors from
plant material in a solvent such as water, oil or alcohol, by allowing the
material to remain suspended in the solvent over time (a process often called
steeping). An 'infusion' is also the name for the resultant liquid. The process
of infusion is distinct from decoction, which involves boiling the plant
material, or percolation, in which the water passes through the material (as in
a coffeemaker).
wiki.title: infusion
